title: How to Replace an Aqua Pure AP810 Water Filter

steps.title: Turn off incoming water by isolating the Aqua-Pure system with existing valves on your homes water supply system.
steps.content: Turn off incoming water by isolating the Aqua-Pure system with existing valves on your homes water supply system.

steps.title: Bleed the pressure from your Aqua-Pure unit by pressing down on the red button (pressure relief button) on the top of the filter housing
steps.content: Bleed the pressure from your Aqua-Pure unit by pressing down on the red button (pressure relief button) on the top of the filter housing

steps.title: Take your filter wrench and slide it up from the bottom of the filter housing towards the head.
steps.content: Take your filter wrench and slide it up from the bottom of the filter housing towards the head. Once in place turn to the left to unscrew.

steps.title: Remove the housing, and wipe it clean, and then insert your new Aqua-Pure AP810 water filter.
steps.content: Remove the housing, and wipe it clean, and then insert your new Aqua-Pure AP810 water filter.

steps.title: Add a small amount of silicone o-ring lubricant (available at most hardware stores) to the O-ring and screw the housing back into the head.
steps.content: Add a small amount of silicone o-ring lubricant (available at most hardware stores) to the O-ring and screw the housing back into the head.

steps.title: Turn back on your water supply to the system.
steps.content: Turn back on your water supply to the system.
